poem.title: Trrism
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: A gnarly tree and every flower Full as a louche. A dust arcade With billiard hall, two travel agents, A plastic surgeon, some antique shops. A wild smell of pork and antiperspirant. "A big sword, then? Abu Sayyaf Sold these to buy their M-16s!" A Song grenade, sweet celadon. Flip-flop in the heat as though Your spine were a stem, your self An insect bathing in the calyx.
